definition: to be taken advantage of
variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
(onom.) dong/ding dong (bell)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
to be forced to suffer in silence/unable to speak of one's bitter suffering
to cheat/to swindle
to cost one dearly/to end disastrously/to pay bitterly
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
to keep one's eyes open (idiom)/to be on one's guard/to be clear-eyed
to be cheated/to be taken in/to be hoodwinked
to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
to comparison shop (idiom)/comparison shopping
to easily trust/gullible/naïve
to swindle
penny wise and pound foolish (idiom)
selective listening/to hear what one wants to hear
to lose everything one invested (idiom)/to lose one's shirt
lit. to drill a hole/to take advantage of a loophole/to exploit an advantage/to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)
credulous
to get smart/to resort to petty tricks
